title: American_Top_40_1984_August_18th
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

Acts hitting the top 40 for the first time include Twisted Sister, Bananarama, and Peter Wolf.

One artist in the countdown has a clause in his performing contract which states that if his name is mis-spelled on tickets, posters, and marquees, he gets a ten percent bonus.

A listener wants to know, "What recording act has put the most songs into the top 40 without ever hitting number one?"

We find out who is the biggest British act in the history of the British charts, and it isn't the Beatles, the Rolling Stones, or Elton John.

The best story Casey tells is of a singer in the countdown who received 50 copies of Billboard Magazine in the mail, and 49 of them weren't his. It seems this artist took out an advertisement on the back cover of the magazine that caused the US post office to also deliver him copies belonging to Hugh Hefner, Frank Sinatra, and Doc Severinsen.

One person becomes the first black recording artist to ever have the same song on the pop chart, the soul chart, and the country chart at the same time.

LW#1: Ghostbusters - Ray Parker Jr.
